title: Sponsored Love: Tradie Roof Racks, Rare Finds For Work Vehicles That Excel in Utility
text:
The Mitsubishi Triton Tradie is a high-utility vehicle specially engineered with efficiency in mind.
The truck sports a spacious bed and a superior payload capacity, making it perfect for running everyday errands or going on off-road adventures. Its rugged construction enables it to withstand adverse weather while making it the highlight of the freeways.
Like most trucks, the Triton Tradie may be subjected to several modifications to enhance efficiency. That includes getting it installed with a roof rack.
Here’s a beginner’s guide to Triton Tradie roof racks.
Benefits of Tradie Roof Racks Getting your Triton Tradie installed with a roof rack is an excellent way to extend the vehicle’s storage capacity.
While the Tradie boasts a relatively spacious bed compared to its closer rivals like the Toyota Hilux, there will be occasions when you need to transport more cargo than the available space can comfortably accommodate. Such are the times when a roof rack can come in handy.
A Tradie roof rack provides a platform for transporting additional items, creating more room in the truck’s bed and cabin.
Other benefits of installing a Tradie roof rack include;
1. Ability to Carry Bulky Items Are you planning to ferry dozens of sheet metal for your new construction project? What are large camping tents for a weeklong picnic?
As either set of materials can be quite bulky, transporting them in your Tradie’s bed may be exceedingly challenging. You can’t arrange them directly over the truck’s roof, as that could lead to costly damages.
The safest way to transport such items is on the roof rack.
Tradie roof racks are fashioned from high-strength metals, making them incredibly robust. Provided that the platform aligns with your truck’s payload capacity, you can use it to transport items that wouldn’t otherwise fit in the bed or cabin.
2. Enhances Everyone’s Comfort Discomfort can ruin what could have been a thrilling road trip.
No one wants to get to their travel destination nursing aching muscles or tender bones. Sadly, that’s what your passengers get if they travel in a Tradie whose cabin is filled to the brim.
A roof rack lets you clear your cabin space of common travel gear like suitcases and jerry cans. This creates extra headroom and legroom for your passengers, ensuring a comfortable trip .
3. Improves Your Tradie’s Safety Safety is a critical consideration when planning any road trip. Whether it’s a short errand to a local hardware store or a daylong picnic at an off-grid location, the danger is never far away.
For utility vehicles like the Tradie, safety risks may be due to erratic load shifts in the vehicle’s bed.
A roof rack minimizes these dangers by promoting weight distribution. Instead of squeezing items into a tiny corner in the cabin, transfer them to the roof rack and spread them evenly across the platform. This improves the truck’s stability by minimizing rollovers and oversteering.
A roof rack also enhances your Tradie’s safety by keeping your valuables out of sight and (depending on the platform’s design) under lock and key. It’s an effective deterrence against muggers who may be drawn by the sight of your personal effects flashing through the cabin side window.
4. Boosts The Truck’s Appearance A roof rack isn’t just a functional Tradie modification. It can also boost your truck’s aesthetic appeal.
Most roof racks sport an athletic appearance.
While this design is primarily intended to reduce aerodynamic drag and noise, it can also add a touch of class to your Tradie and make it the highlight of the freeways.
Choosing the Best Tradie Roof Rack There are plenty of Triton Tradie roof racks to explore. The trick is to choose a platform that aligns perfectly with your model.
Besides, understand the type of gear you intend to transport on your Tradie roof rack before picking the platform.
For instance, roof rails are ideal for transporting longer items like iron sheets. In contrast, you may consider crossbars to carry smaller luggage, such as cargo carriers and kayak racks.
Construction material is another important consideration when shopping for a roof rack.
Most Tradie roof racks are made from metal, although plastic and fiberglass options exist as well. Commonly used metals include steel and aluminum.
While steel racks can safely transport heavier items, their sheer bulkiness can diminish your Tradie’s payload capacity. Aluminum is reasonably lighter but no less robust than steel. It can also outlive steel due to its superior resistance to rust and corrosion.
The height of your Tradie roof rack also impacts the vehicle’s performance.
Taller racks, such as mobility scooters, may be desirable for transporting longer items that must remain upright. However, a high-profile roof rack can impede access through low-hanging roadway obstacles.
An even bigger concern with taller roof racks is that they can raise your Tradie’s center of gravity (CoG) , increasing the risks of rollovers.
Final Thoughts The perks of outfitting your Triton Tradie with a roof rack are immense. From extending the truck’s storage space to improving the vehicle’s stability…there’s more to benefit from installing a roof rack on your Tradie.
However, the efficiency of a Triton Tradie roof rack depends primarily on the selected platform.
Insist on a roof rack designed specifically for your Tradie’s model. Besides, the platform should be perfectly adapted for the items you plan on transporting.
Remember to follow the manufacturer’s care and maintenance plan for your Tradie’s roof rack.
